# Git lingo

The git world comes with its own language. This can be a little intimidating at first.
Here we provide a first overview of the concepts and words used to get you started. 
Each of the concepts will be explained in more detail in the corresponding section.

repository (repo)
	a repository is a directory managed by git. In plain language it is a folder on your computer (i.e. a local repository) 
	or a folder on a server (a remote repository) that git recognizes.
stage
staging area
working directory
working tree
history
remote repository (remote)
master
origin
push
pull 
merge
pull request
rebase
commit
commit message
tag
branch
index
